      • detectEnemy

        private static void detectEnemy(Drone attacker,
                                Swarm defenders,
                                int[] minArray)
        detectEnemy() uses the Vector330Class to determine the enemy closest to a selected warrior and store the closest warrior, its magnitude, and army in the array
        Parameters:
        attacker - the specific warrior to detect the closest enemy for
        defenders - the entire enemy army

      • outOfBounds

        private static boolean outOfBounds(Drone attacker)
        outOfBounds() detects if a specific warrior is out of the bounds of the graphics window
        Parameters:
        attacker - the warrior to check its position
        Returns:
        a true if out of bounds

      • moveDrones

        static void moveDrones()
        moveWarriors() will move all warriors of the respective armies closer to closest enemy detected

      • drawDrone

        private static void drawDrone(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Swarm> armies)
        drawWarriors() puts the alive warriors of each army on screen in accordance with their x and y positions
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics window to draw to
        armies - a array list containing all the armies in play

      • droneDamage

        private static void droneDamage(java.util.ArrayList<Swarm> armies)

      • magnitude

        private static double magnitude(Drone soldier,
                                Swarm defender,
                                int index)
        magnitude() calculates the distance from a selected soldier to the closest enemy
        Parameters:
        soldier - the selected warrior to compare its distance from a selected enemy
        defender - an army containing enemy warriors
        index - the location of the closest enemy to the selected warrior
        Returns:
        the distance between a warrior and a selected enemy

      • armySize

        static Swarm armySize(int allianceNumber,
                      java.lang.String name)
        armySize takes in a (currently) class variable and uses that number to set the number of drones in an army
        Parameters:
        allianceNumber - the identifier of a swarm
        name - the name of the swarm
        Returns:
        a new swarm, or collection of drones
